reporting-org.narrative: Bundesministerium für wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung (BMZ)
Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)

title.narrative: Integrated Solid Waste Management Program II - Samegrelo-Zemo Svaneti and Kakheti

description.narrative: Aim of the FC-project is to carry out a climate friendly and ecologically beneficial solid waste management system in exclusive regions of Georgia (Samegrelo-Zemo Svaneti). The project contributes to the ecologic and sustainable development of the region and aims to avoid climate damaging emissions. The additional phase of the solid waste project is a reasonable extension of FC-engagement in Georgia and in particular the project "Klimafreundliche Abfallwirtschaft, Phase I" (BMZ-Nr. 2011 66 479) which is about climate friendly solutions in solid waste management. Arrangements depend on how much solid waste management systems, waste trucks or waste containers are needed in local regions. The plan is to connect as many cities as possible to the new system. In addition it is planned to close all the already existing old waste disposal sites. Another arrangement is to increase public acceptance over waste prevention, recycling and fees to create a fair payment for solid waste system workers to ensure a sustainable business. The project is going to affect 890.000 local citizens that will profit from prevention of negative environmental impact and reduction of disposal site fires that intoxicate the air. Prevention of climate damaging emissions is benefitting the safety of public goods and contributes to international arrangements for sustainable living conditions. Projectpartner is the ministry of finance of the Georgian government that hands the money to the Solid Waste Management Company of Georgia (SWMCG) that will carry out the arrangements. The project is financed through a FC development loan with an amount of 30 Mio EUR that is reduced in price through 5 Mio EUR from BMZ. There is a complimentary arrangement worth 2 Mio EUR and in addition further education training to strengthen the SWMCG and the affected regions. Furthermore NIF, EU and/ or Eastern Europe Energy Efficiency and Environment Partnership (E5P) are willing to finance more projects if necessary.
Umwelt- und Ressourcenschutz, Vermeidung klimaschädlicher Emissionen, Verbesserung der öffentlichen Gesundheit

Aim of the FC-project is to carry out a climate friendly and ecologically beneficial solid waste management system in exclusive regions of Georgia (Samegrelo-Zemo Svaneti). The project contributes to the ecologic and sustainable development of the region and aims to avoid climate damaging emissions. The additional phase of the solid waste project is a reasonable extension of FC-engagement in Georgia and in particular the project "Klimafreundliche Abfallwirtschaft, Phase I" (BMZ-Nr. 2011 66 479) which is about climate friendly solutions in solid waste management. Arrangements depend on how much solid waste management systems, waste trucks or waste containers are needed in local regions. The plan is to connect as many cities as possible to the new system. In addition it is planned to close all the already existing old waste disposal sites. Another arrangement is to increase public acceptance over waste prevention, recycling and fees to create a fair payment for solid waste system workers to ensure a sustainable business. The project is going to affect 890.000 local citizens that will profit from prevention of negative environmental impact and reduction of disposal site fires that intoxicate the air. Prevention of climate damaging emissions is benefitting the safety of public goods and contributes to international arrangements for sustainable living conditions. Projectpartner is the ministry of finance of the Georgian government that hands the money to the Solid Waste Management Company of Georgia (SWMCG) that will carry out the arrangements. The project is financed through a FC development loan with an amount of 30 Mio EUR that is reduced in price through 5 Mio EUR from BMZ. There is a complimentary arrangement worth 2 Mio EUR and in addition further education training to strengthen the SWMCG and the affected regions. Furthermore NIF, EU and/ or Eastern Europe Energy Efficiency and Environment Partnership (E5P) are willing to finance more projects if necessary.

Ziel des Vorhabens "Klimafreundliche Abfallwirtschaft II" ist die Einführung von integrierten, um-welt- und klimafreundlichen Abfallwirtschaftssystemen in den georgischen Regionen Kachetien und Samegrelo-Zemo Svaneti (Modulziel). Es soll damit einen Beitrag zum Umwelt- und Res-sourcenschutz, zur Vermeidung klimaschädlicher Emissionen und zur Verbesserung der öffent-lichen Gesundheit leisten (entwicklungspolitisches Ziel). Zielgruppe ist die in den Projektregionen lebende Bevölkerung (rd. 675.000 Einwohner). Das Vorhaben ist eine Folgephase des laufenden FZ-Vorhabens "Klimafreundliche Abfallwirtschaft I" (BMZ-Nr. 2011 66 479) in den Regionen Imereti und Racha-Lechkhumi/Kvemo Svaneti. Die Projektmaßnahmen umfassen den Bau und die Ausstattung von zwei regionalen, EU-Standards entsprechenden Siedlungsabfalldeponien sowie Transferstationen, die Lieferung von Ausrüstung für kommunale Abfalldienstleistungen und die umweltgerechte Schließung von Alt-deponien. Hinzu kommen Pilotprojekte für Recycling und Kompostierung. Im Rahmen der Be-gleitmaßnahme sollen der Projektträger - die Solid Waste Management Company of Georgia (SWMCG) - und die beteiligten Kommunen institutionell und fachlich gestärkt, hinsichtlich der Gewährleistung eines kosteneffizienten Betriebs beraten und bei der Umsetzung öffentlich-keitswirksamer Maßnahmen unterstützt werden. Die Gesamtkosten des Vorhabens betragen 35,4 Mio. EUR. Die Investitionskosten belaufen sich auf 33,4 Mio. EUR und werden finanziert durch einen FZ-Entwicklungskredit (Zinsverbilligung) von bis zu 30,0 Mio. EUR unter Nutzung von bis zu 5,0 Mio. EUR ZV-Mitteln sowie durch Eigenbeiträge der georgischen Seite i. H. v. 3,4 Mio. EUR. Die Kosten für die Begleitmaßnahme i. H. v. 2,0 Mio. EUR werden durch einen FZ-Zuschuss finanziert.

title.narrative: Für dieses Vorhaben liegt kein Eintrag zur Umwelt- und Sozialverträglichkeit vor.
Für dieses Vorhaben liegt kein Projektbudget-Dokument vor.
